text: The Sharafat Kuh Front was an Afghan mujahideen group active in the 1980s in Farah Province. It was led by Mulawi Mohammad Shah, an Achakzai Pashtun.J. Bruce Amstutz. Afghanistan: The First Five Years of Soviet Occupation. DIANE Publishing, 1994. , The group was named after the Sharafat Kuh, a large mountain southeast of the city of Farah which served as a mujahideen stronghold. ==References== Category:History of Farah Province Category:Soviet–Afghan War Category:Paramilitary organisations based in Afghanistan
title: Sharafat Kuh Front
